contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Yung Shue Wan from the ferry pier.jpg|right|thumb|The village of Yung Shue Wan from the ferry terminal.]] [[File:Yung Shue Wa Bay tenements at Lamma Island, HK, 2008.JPG|right|thumb|Yung Shue Wan tenement homes reusing old materials.]] [[File:Yung Shue Wa Bay Boats at Lamma Island, HK.JPG|right|thumb|Yung Shue Wan bay boats rest in the low tide.]] '''Yung Shue Wan''' ({{zh|t=榕樹灣}}, Banyan Bay) is the main population centre on [[Lamma Island]], [[Hong Kong]]. It has a population of approximately 6,000. ==Features== The village is a mix of residential properties, shops and restaurants. Yung Shue Wan gives a Mediterranean feeling when walking through it. In addition to the indigenous residents, the quiet and laid-back lifestyle make it an attractive and popular living location for middle-class commuters. It is popular with expatriates. There is a [[Tin Hau temples in Hong Kong|Tin Hau Temple]] in Yung Shue Wan.<ref>[http://www.islandsdc.gov.hk/index.php?action=sight&did=8&sid=61 Tin Hau Temple, Yung Shue Wan]</ref> ==Transportation== Yung Shue Wan can be reached by [[ferry]] from the Outlying Islands Ferry Pier No. 4 in [[Central, Hong Kong|Central]], which takes about 25 minutes, or from [[Aberdeen Harbour|Aberdeen]], which takes about 40 minutes. ===Lamma Island ferry collision=== {{main|2012 Lamma Island ferry collision}} On 1 October 2012, at approximately 20:20 [[Hong Kong Time|HKT]], a [[ferry]] and another passenger vessel collided off Yung Shue Wan, [[Lamma Island]], Hong Kong.<ref name="cnn">{{Cite news|title=At least 37 killed in Hong Kong's deadliest ferry accident in decades|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/10/02/world/asia/hong-kong-ferry-crash/index.html|accessdate=2 October 2012|publisher=CNN|date=2 October 2012|last1=Armstrong|first1=Paul|first2=Jethro|last2=Mullen}}</ref> The day was the [[National Day of the People's Republic of China]], and one of the ships was headed for the commemorative firework display, scheduled to take place half an hour later. With 39 killed and more than 100 injured,<ref>{{Cite news|title=Hong Kong boat crash off Lamma Island kills 36|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-19790977|accessdate=2 October 2012|publisher=BBC News|date=2 October 2012}}</ref> the incident was the deadliest maritime disaster in Hong Kong since 1971.<ref name="cnn"/> ==See also== [[Image:Yung Shue Wan - Sunset Bastards Boulevard.JPG|right|thumb|The Fountainhead bar in Main Street, Yung Shue Wan]] * [[List of buildings, sites, and areas in Hong Kong]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Yung Shue Wan}} * [http://www.td.gov.hk/transport_in_hong_kong/index.htm Transport Department site giving routes and timetables] {{Coord|22|13|35|N|114|6|43|E|display=title|type:isle}} [[Category:Bays of Hong Kong]] [[Category:Lamma Island]] [[Category:Populated places in Hong Kong]] {{HK-geo-stub}}
